content: evelyn clark designs swallowtail lace shawl a border of lily of the valley adds an interesting counterpoint to the tiny budding lace pattern at the top of this small shawl it ends with a scalloped edging and the lace throughout has an estonian influence this shawl looks great in both solid and semi-solid color lace fingering and shetland/sport/dk weight yarns this design originally appeared in the fall 2006 issue of interweave knits advanced skill needed knitting nupps abbreviations increase increase 1 by knitting in front and back of stitch k knit k2tog knit 2 stitches together p purl p5tog purl 5 stitches together rs right side of shawl sk2p slip 1 stitch knitwise k2tog and pass slipped stitch over k2tog ssk slip 1 stitch knitwise slip next stitch knit- wise replace on holding needle and k2tog through back loops st s stitch es st st stockinette stitch sample shawl ws wrong side of shawl 50g 437 yds/400m misti alpaca lace lace weight yo yarn over yarn 23 wpi 100% baby alpaca color 7120 * repeat instructions between asterisks repeat instructions inside brackets specified circular needles number of times or to remaining number of 24 61 cm or longer needles in size to obtain stitches gauge suggested sizes shown below yarn weight yarn amount circular needles 4 10cm st st gauge blocked size lace 437 yds 400m us 4 3 5mm 22 sts 25 x 50 18+wpi 63 5 x 127cm fingering 516 yds 471m us 6 4mm 18 sts 27 x 54 16 17 wpi 68 5 x 137cm shetland/sport/dk 612yds 559m us 8 5mm 14 sts 32 x 64 13 15 wpi 81 x 162cm www evelynclarkdesigns com swallowtail lace shawl ©2008 by evelyn a clark paig0e0  instructions supplies budding lace beginning chart 1 2 stitch markers 1 coilless safety pin tapestry row 1 rs k2 *yo k1 yo place marker * k1 needle to weave in yarn ends and rustproof pins repeat between *s k2 11 sts for blocking all even row ws k2 purl to last 2 sts k2 row 3 k2 *yo k3 yo * k1 repeat between *s optional supplies k2 15 sts 1 yd 1m smooth waste yarn and crochet hook for row 5 k2 *yo k5 yo * k1 repeat between *s provisional cast-on and blocking wires k2 19 sts row 7 k2 *yo k1 yo ssk k1 k2tog yo k1 yo * shawl notes k1 repeat between *s k2 23 sts 1 shawl is a triangle made up of 2 triangles row 9 k2 *yo k3 yo sk2p yo k3 yo * k1 separated by the center stitch it is worked repeat between *s k2 27 sts start budding from the top down and increases 4 stitches lace repeat every other row to the edging 2 it is helpful to place markers before the center budding lace repeat chart 2 stitch and the last 2 border stitches as well work row 1 6 for pattern instructions inside as to hang a
